description: LLM task completion benchmark tasks for comparing Calor vs C#

tasks.name: Factorial Function
tasks.description: Compute the factorial of a non-negative integer

prompts.calor: Write a Calor function named Factorial that computes the factorial of a non-negative integer n. Include a precondition §Q that n >= 0 and a postcondition §S that result >= 1. Use i32 types. The function should be public (pub) and use proper Calor syntax with §M, §F, §I, §O, §Q, §S, §IF, §R markers and S-expression math like (* n (Factorial (- n 1))).
prompts.csharp: Write a C# public static method named Factorial in a public static class that computes the factorial of a non-negative integer n. The method should take an int parameter and return an int.

tasks.name: Fibonacci Number
tasks.description: Compute the nth Fibonacci number

prompts.calor: Write a Calor function named Fibonacci that computes the nth Fibonacci number (0, 1, 1, 2, 3, 5, 8...). Include a precondition §Q that n >= 0. Use i32 types and proper Calor syntax with §M, §F, §I, §O, §Q, §IF, §R markers.
prompts.csharp: Write a C# public static method named Fibonacci in a public static class that computes the nth Fibonacci number. The method should take an int parameter n and return an int.

tasks.name: Is Prime
tasks.description: Check if a number is prime

prompts.calor: Write a Calor function named IsPrime that returns true if a given positive integer n is prime, false otherwise. Include a precondition §Q that n > 0. Use i32 for input and bool for output. Use proper Calor syntax with §M, §F, §I, §O, §Q, §IF, §L (loop), §R markers and S-expression comparisons like (== (% n i) 0).
prompts.csharp: Write a C# public static method named IsPrime in a public static class that returns true if a given positive integer is prime, false otherwise. The method should take an int parameter and return a bool.

tasks.name: Greatest Common Divisor
tasks.description: Compute the GCD of two positive integers using Euclidean algorithm

prompts.calor: Write a Calor function named Gcd that computes the greatest common divisor of two positive integers a and b using the Euclidean algorithm. Include preconditions §Q that a > 0 and b > 0, and a postcondition §S that result > 0. Use i32 types and proper Calor syntax.
prompts.csharp: Write a C# public static method named Gcd in a public static class that computes the greatest common divisor of two positive integers using the Euclidean algorithm. The method should take two int parameters and return an int.

tasks.name: Absolute Value
tasks.description: Return the absolute value of an integer

prompts.calor: Write a Calor function named Abs that returns the absolute value of an integer n. Include a postcondition §S that result >= 0. Use i32 types and proper Calor syntax with §IF for the conditional.
prompts.csharp: Write a C# public static method named Abs in a public static class that returns the absolute value of an integer. The method should take an int parameter and return an int.

tasks.name: Power Function
tasks.description: Compute base raised to exponent power

prompts.calor: Write a Calor function named Power that computes base^exp for non-negative exponent. Include a precondition §Q that exp >= 0. Use i32 types and proper Calor syntax.
prompts.csharp: Write a C# public static method named Power in a public static class that computes base raised to the power of exp. The method should take two int parameters and return an int.

tasks.name: Is Even
tasks.description: Check if a number is even

prompts.calor: Write a Calor function named IsEven that returns true if n is even. Use i32 for input and bool for output. Use S-expression (== (% n 2) 0).
prompts.csharp: Write a C# public static method named IsEven in a public static class that returns true if the given integer is even. The method should take an int parameter and return a bool.

tasks.name: Is Odd
tasks.description: Check if a number is odd

prompts.calor: Write a Calor function named IsOdd that returns true if n is odd. Use i32 for input and bool for output. Use S-expression (!= (% n 2) 0).
prompts.csharp: Write a C# public static method named IsOdd in a public static class that returns true if the given integer is odd. The method should take an int parameter and return a bool.

tasks.name: Sign
tasks.description: Return the sign of a number (-1, 0, or 1)

prompts.calor: Write a Calor function named Sign that returns -1 if n < 0, 0 if n == 0, 1 if n > 0. Use i32 types and §IF/§EI/§EL conditionals.
prompts.csharp: Write a C# public static method named Sign in a public static class that returns -1 if n < 0, 0 if n == 0, 1 if n > 0. The method should take an int parameter and return an int.

tasks.name: Square
tasks.description: Return the square of a number

prompts.calor: Write a Calor function named Square that returns n squared. Use i32 types and S-expression (* n n).
prompts.csharp: Write a C# public static method named Square in a public static class that returns the square of a number. The method should take an int parameter and return an int.

tasks.name: Cube
tasks.description: Return the cube of a number

prompts.calor: Write a Calor function named Cube that returns n cubed. Use i32 types and S-expression (* n (* n n)).
prompts.csharp: Write a C# public static method named Cube in a public static class that returns the cube of a number. The method should take an int parameter and return an int.

tasks.name: Double
tasks.description: Return double the value

prompts.calor: Write a Calor function named Double that returns n * 2. Use i32 types and S-expression (* n 2).
prompts.csharp: Write a C# public static method named Double in a public static class that returns double the input value. The method should take an int parameter and return an int.

tasks.name: Negate
tasks.description: Return the negation of a number

prompts.calor: Write a Calor function named Negate that returns -n. Use i32 types and S-expression (- 0 n) for negation.
prompts.csharp: Write a C# public static method named Negate in a public static class that returns the negation of a number. The method should take an int parameter and return an int.

tasks.name: Is Positive
tasks.description: Check if a number is positive

prompts.calor: Write a Calor function named IsPositive that returns true if n > 0. Use i32 for input and bool for output.
prompts.csharp: Write a C# public static method named IsPositive in a public static class that returns true if the number is positive. The method should take an int parameter and return a bool.

tasks.name: Is Negative
tasks.description: Check if a number is negative

prompts.calor: Write a Calor function named IsNegative that returns true if n < 0. Use i32 for input and bool for output.
prompts.csharp: Write a C# public static method named IsNegative in a public static class that returns true if the number is negative. The method should take an int parameter and return a bool.

tasks.name: Safe Division
tasks.description: Divide two integers with contract preventing division by zero

prompts.calor: Write a Calor function named SafeDivide that divides integer a by integer b. Include a precondition §Q that b != 0 (use (!= b 0)) to prevent division by zero. Use i32 types and proper Calor syntax.
prompts.csharp: Write a C# public static method named SafeDivide in a public static class that divides integer a by integer b. Throw an ArgumentException if b is 0. The method should take two int parameters and return an int.

tasks.name: Clamp Value
tasks.description: Clamp a value between min and max with contracts

prompts.calor: Write a Calor function named Clamp that returns value clamped between min and max. Include a precondition §Q that min <= max (use (<= min max)). Include a postcondition §S that result >= min and result <= max. Use i32 types and proper Calor syntax with §IF conditionals.
prompts.csharp: Write a C# public static method named Clamp in a public static class that returns value clamped between min and max. Throw ArgumentException if min > max. The method should take three int parameters (value, min, max) and return an int.

tasks.name: Safe Modulo
tasks.description: Compute modulo with contract preventing division by zero

prompts.calor: Write a Calor function named SafeModulo that returns a % b. Include a precondition §Q that b != 0. Use i32 types.
prompts.csharp: Write a C# public static method named SafeModulo in a public static class that returns a % b. Throw ArgumentException if b is 0. The method should take two int parameters and return an int.

tasks.name: Percentage
tasks.description: Calculate percentage with valid range contracts

prompts.calor: Write a Calor function named Percentage that returns (value * percent) / 100. Include preconditions §Q that percent >= 0 and percent <= 100. Use i32 types.
prompts.csharp: Write a C# public static method named Percentage in a public static class that returns (value * percent) / 100. Throw ArgumentException if percent is not between 0 and 100. The method should take two int parameters and return an int.

tasks.name: Safe Array Index
tasks.description: Validate array index with contracts

prompts.calor: Write a Calor function named ValidIndex that returns true if index is valid for an array of given size. Include precondition §Q that size > 0. Use i32 for inputs and bool for output.
prompts.csharp: Write a C# public static method named ValidIndex in a public static class that returns true if index is valid for an array of given size. The method should take two int parameters (index, size) and return a bool.

tasks.name: In Range
tasks.description: Check if value is in range with contracts

prompts.calor: Write a Calor function named InRange that returns true if value is between min and max (inclusive). Include precondition §Q that min <= max. Use i32 for inputs and bool for output.
prompts.csharp: Write a C# public static method named InRange in a public static class that returns true if value is between min and max (inclusive). The method should take three int parameters (value, min, max) and return a bool.

tasks.name: Positive Difference
tasks.description: Return positive difference between two numbers

prompts.calor: Write a Calor function named PositiveDiff that returns the positive difference between a and b. Include postcondition §S that result >= 0. Use i32 types.
prompts.csharp: Write a C# public static method named PositiveDiff in a public static class that returns the absolute difference between two numbers. The method should take two int parameters and return an int.

tasks.name: Half Value
tasks.description: Return half of an even number

prompts.calor: Write a Calor function named HalfEven that returns n / 2 for even n. Include precondition §Q that n is even (== (% n 2) 0). Use i32 types.
prompts.csharp: Write a C# public static method named HalfEven in a public static class that returns n / 2. Throw ArgumentException if n is odd. The method should take an int parameter and return an int.

tasks.name: Score Normalize
tasks.description: Normalize a score to 0-100 range

prompts.calor: Write a Calor function named NormalizeScore that normalizes a score from a given max to 0-100. Formula: (score * 100) / maxScore. Include preconditions §Q that maxScore > 0 and score >= 0 and score <= maxScore. Use i32 types.
prompts.csharp: Write a C# public static method named NormalizeScore in a public static class that normalizes a score to 0-100 range. Formula: (score * 100) / maxScore. The method should take two int parameters (score, maxScore) and return an int.

tasks.name: Safe Decrement
tasks.description: Decrement a positive number

prompts.calor: Write a Calor function named SafeDecrement that returns n - 1 for positive n. Include precondition §Q that n > 0. Include postcondition §S that result >= 0. Use i32 types.
prompts.csharp: Write a C# public static method named SafeDecrement in a public static class that returns n - 1. Throw ArgumentException if n <= 0. The method should take an int parameter and return an int.

tasks.name: Sum Two Numbers
tasks.description: Sum two integers

prompts.calor: Write a Calor function named Sum that returns the sum of two integers a and b. Use i32 types and proper Calor syntax with S-expression (+ a b) for addition.
prompts.csharp: Write a C# public static method named Sum in a public static class that returns the sum of two integers. The method should take two int parameters and return an int.

tasks.name: Find Maximum of Two
tasks.description: Find the maximum of two integers

prompts.calor: Write a Calor function named Max that returns the maximum of two integers a and b. Use i32 types and proper Calor syntax with §IF conditional and S-expression (> a b) for comparison.
prompts.csharp: Write a C# public static method named Max in a public static class that returns the maximum of two integers. The method should take two int parameters and return an int.

tasks.name: Find Minimum of Two
tasks.description: Find the minimum of two integers

prompts.calor: Write a Calor function named Min that returns the minimum of two integers a and b. Use i32 types and proper Calor syntax with §IF conditional and S-expression (< a b) for comparison.
prompts.csharp: Write a C# public static method named Min in a public static class that returns the minimum of two integers. The method should take two int parameters and return an int.

tasks.name: Difference
tasks.description: Return the difference of two numbers

prompts.calor: Write a Calor function named Difference that returns a - b. Use i32 types and S-expression (- a b).
prompts.csharp: Write a C# public static method named Difference in a public static class that returns a - b. The method should take two int parameters and return an int.

tasks.name: Product
tasks.description: Return the product of two numbers

prompts.calor: Write a Calor function named Product that returns a * b. Use i32 types and S-expression (* a b).
prompts.csharp: Write a C# public static method named Product in a public static class that returns a * b. The method should take two int parameters and return an int.

tasks.name: Average
tasks.description: Return the integer average of two numbers

prompts.calor: Write a Calor function named Average that returns (a + b) / 2. Use i32 types and S-expressions.
prompts.csharp: Write a C# public static method named Average in a public static class that returns the integer average of two numbers. The method should take two int parameters and return an int.

tasks.name: Is Zero
tasks.description: Check if a number is zero

prompts.calor: Write a Calor function named IsZero that returns true if n == 0. Use i32 for input and bool for output.
prompts.csharp: Write a C# public static method named IsZero in a public static class that returns true if n equals 0. The method should take an int parameter and return a bool.

tasks.name: Increment
tasks.description: Increment a number by one

prompts.calor: Write a Calor function named Increment that returns n + 1. Use i32 types and S-expression (+ n 1).
prompts.csharp: Write a C# public static method named Increment in a public static class that returns n + 1. The method should take an int parameter and return an int.

tasks.name: Decrement
tasks.description: Decrement a number by one

prompts.calor: Write a Calor function named Decrement that returns n - 1. Use i32 types and S-expression (- n 1).
prompts.csharp: Write a C# public static method named Decrement in a public static class that returns n - 1. The method should take an int parameter and return an int.

tasks.name: Median of Three
tasks.description: Find the median of three numbers

prompts.calor: Write a Calor function named Median3 that returns the median of three integers a, b, c. Use i32 types and nested §IF conditionals.
prompts.csharp: Write a C# public static method named Median3 in a public static class that returns the median of three integers. The method should take three int parameters and return an int.

tasks.name: Bool To Int
tasks.description: Convert boolean to integer (true=1, false=0)

prompts.calor: Write a Calor function named BoolToInt that returns 1 if b is true, 0 if false. Use bool for input and i32 for output.
prompts.csharp: Write a C# public static method named BoolToInt in a public static class that returns 1 if the bool is true, 0 otherwise. The method should take a bool parameter and return an int.

tasks.name: Int To Bool
tasks.description: Convert integer to boolean (0=false, nonzero=true)

prompts.calor: Write a Calor function named IntToBool that returns false if n is 0, true otherwise. Use i32 for input and bool for output.
prompts.csharp: Write a C# public static method named IntToBool in a public static class that returns false if n is 0, true otherwise. The method should take an int parameter and return a bool.

tasks.name: Logical And
tasks.description: Logical AND of two booleans

prompts.calor: Write a Calor function named And that returns a && b. Use bool for inputs and output.
prompts.csharp: Write a C# public static method named And in a public static class that returns a && b. The method should take two bool parameters and return a bool.

tasks.name: Logical Or
tasks.description: Logical OR of two booleans

prompts.calor: Write a Calor function named Or that returns a || b. Use bool for inputs and output.
prompts.csharp: Write a C# public static method named Or in a public static class that returns a || b. The method should take two bool parameters and return a bool.

tasks.name: Logical Not
tasks.description: Logical NOT of a boolean

prompts.calor: Write a Calor function named Not that returns !b. Use bool for input and output.
prompts.csharp: Write a C# public static method named Not in a public static class that returns !b. The method should take a bool parameter and return a bool.

tasks.name: Logical Xor
tasks.description: Logical XOR of two booleans

prompts.calor: Write a Calor function named Xor that returns true if exactly one of a or b is true. Use bool for inputs and output.
prompts.csharp: Write a C# public static method named Xor in a public static class that returns true if exactly one of a or b is true. The method should take two bool parameters and return a bool.

tasks.name: Are Equal
tasks.description: Check if two integers are equal

prompts.calor: Write a Calor function named AreEqual that returns true if a == b. Use i32 for inputs and bool for output.
prompts.csharp: Write a C# public static method named AreEqual in a public static class that returns true if a equals b. The method should take two int parameters and return a bool.

tasks.name: Are Not Equal
tasks.description: Check if two integers are not equal

prompts.calor: Write a Calor function named AreNotEqual that returns true if a != b. Use i32 for inputs and bool for output.
prompts.csharp: Write a C# public static method named AreNotEqual in a public static class that returns true if a does not equal b. The method should take two int parameters and return a bool.

tasks.name: Both Positive
tasks.description: Check if both numbers are positive

prompts.calor: Write a Calor function named BothPositive that returns true if both a > 0 and b > 0. Use i32 for inputs and bool for output.
prompts.csharp: Write a C# public static method named BothPositive in a public static class that returns true if both a and b are positive. The method should take two int parameters and return a bool.

tasks.name: Either Positive
tasks.description: Check if either number is positive

prompts.calor: Write a Calor function named EitherPositive that returns true if a > 0 or b > 0. Use i32 for inputs and bool for output.
prompts.csharp: Write a C# public static method named EitherPositive in a public static class that returns true if either a or b is positive. The method should take two int parameters and return a bool.

tasks.name: Same Sign
tasks.description: Check if two numbers have the same sign

prompts.calor: Write a Calor function named SameSign that returns true if a and b are both positive, both negative, or both zero. Use i32 for inputs and bool for output.
prompts.csharp: Write a C# public static method named SameSign in a public static class that returns true if a and b have the same sign. The method should take two int parameters and return a bool.

tasks.name: Is Multiple Of
tasks.description: Check if a is a multiple of b

prompts.calor: Write a Calor function named IsMultipleOf that returns true if a is a multiple of b (a % b == 0). Include precondition §Q that b != 0. Use i32 for inputs and bool for output.
prompts.csharp: Write a C# public static method named IsMultipleOf in a public static class that returns true if a is a multiple of b. The method should take two int parameters and return a bool.

tasks.name: Is Greater Than
tasks.description: Check if a is greater than b

prompts.calor: Write a Calor function named IsGreaterThan that returns true if a > b. Use i32 for inputs and bool for output.
prompts.csharp: Write a C# public static method named IsGreaterThan in a public static class that returns true if a > b. The method should take two int parameters and return a bool.

tasks.name: Is Less Than
tasks.description: Check if a is less than b

prompts.calor: Write a Calor function named IsLessThan that returns true if a < b. Use i32 for inputs and bool for output.
prompts.csharp: Write a C# public static method named IsLessThan in a public static class that returns true if a < b. The method should take two int parameters and return a bool.

tasks.name: Implies
tasks.description: Logical implication (a implies b)

prompts.calor: Write a Calor function named Implies that returns !a || b (logical implication). Use bool for inputs and output.
prompts.csharp: Write a C# public static method named Implies in a public static class that returns !a || b (logical implication). The method should take two bool parameters and return a bool.
